intro: Freylinia crispa, commonly known as the smooth freylinia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to South Africa and is characterized by its shrub-like growth habit with woody stems. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically greenish-yellow in color. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and have a smooth, waxy texture. Freylinia crispa is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments.
